Independence and the Courage to Be Right 


     Christians should not take pains to make themselves 
                                                                           243
a gazingstock by dressing differently from the world. But if, when following out their convictions of duty in respect to dressing modestly and healthfully, they find themselves out of fashion, they should not change their dress in order to be like the world; but they should manifest a noble independence and moral courage to be right, if all the world differ from them.--Testimonies, vol. 1, p. 458.
